title: Single mom with $80,000 in debt..should I file bankruptcy?
question: I'm a single mom with a new baby.....I was very sick in pregnancy and now have a colicky baby, so have been out of work and don't expect to be able to work until the new year (no maternity leave). When I start working, and subtracting the cost of childcare and raising my child, I don't expect to make more than $20,000 next year.
answers:
The entire purpose of bankruptcy is to give people who are swamped by debt a fresh start. Most bankruptcy attorneys give free initial consultations. It would pay to check to see how it would work for you.

The National Association of Consumer Advocates (NACA) maintains a web site at www.naca.net where it lists geographically consumer law attorneys all over the US.
